blogs.title: The great Everest oxygen debate: was anyone really a 'rotter'? | Vanessa Heggie
blogs.summary: Two famous quotes come from the British attempts to climb Everest in the 1920s. One is George Mallory's justification, 'because it is there', and the other is astronomer A Hinks' claim that 'only rotters would use oxygen'. We may never understand quite wha

author.name: Science: The H word | guardian.co.uk
author.description: Rebekah Higgitt of the National Maritime Museum in Greenwich and Vanessa Heggie at the University of Cambridge write about the untold history of science

blogs.title: The first flight over Everest: a physiologist's dream | Vanessa Heggie
blogs.summary: It's the 80th anniversary of the first flight over the summit of Everest – an idea first planned by a British physiologist in 1918On April 3 1933 Lieut. David McIntyre and Sir Douglas Douglas-Hamilton were the first men to fly over the summit of Everest.
